isis.stitle: HUBS, BEARINGS, AND SEALS (NON-DRIVE AXLES) - WHEEL BEARINGS - BEARING CUP (RACE)

svcsubproc.title: Remove (Cast Iron Hub Assembly)
svcsubproc.para: Removal is done with hub assembly removed from vehicle (with or without wheel(s) removed from hub assembly), and inner bearing and seal removed from hub assembly.

step1.para: To remove inner bearing cup, place hub assembly flat on floor with outer bearing facing up (toward you).

Use a long suitable steel punch placed through the hub bore. In most cases, the hub assembly will have a couple of notches machined out of the hub assembly. These notches are there for the removal of the bearing cup.

Place the punch in the notch on the cup. Strike the punch with a hammer. Move the punch to the opposite notch and repeat procedure. Moving back and forth in the notches and striking the cup will force the cup from the hub.

note.para: If hub does not have removal notches machined into the hub assembly, use a suitable steel punch with a flat end. Place punch on cup portion that is protruding from hub assembly. Strike punch with hammer and work your way around cup in a criss-cross pattern, forcing cup from hub.
To remove outer bearing cup, place hub assembly on floor with brake drum/disc facing up (toward you) and repeat steps 2 and 3 above.

step1.para: To install inner bearing cup, place hub assembly on floor with brake drum/disc facing up (toward you).
Lube hub cup surface and outer cup surface with engine oil and place cup into hub bore in the same position as the one removed.
Using a brass drift, punch with a flat end and a hammer, and tap cup into bore. Be sure cup is not cocked.
Working around the circumference of the cup in a criss-cross pattern, drive cup into the hub bore until it is bottomed.
Clean any brass shavings from bore.
To install outer bearing cup, place hub assembly on floor with brake drum/disc facing floor and repeat steps 2 through 5 above.

svcsubproc.title: Remove (Aluminum Hub) (Wheel Assembly Removed From Hub)

step1.para: Clean hub with a non-flammable cleaner.
Place the hub on a firm, clean surface with the cup to be removed facing down.
Using a hammer and a drift, carefully drive the cup out of the hub by striking on the lip of the cup. It is necessary to use many soft blows placed about 90° apart.

svcsubproc.para: Alternate Method: After the hub is clean from grease and debris, place hub in an oven and heat the hub assembly evenly to 180°F to 210°F. Quickly remove the hub from the oven and place the hub on a firm, clean surface with the cup to be removed facing down, then proceed with step 3.

warning.para: Wear gloves when handling hot hub assembly to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: The bore must be clean of grease and debris. Heat the hub evenly throughout in an oven to 180°F to 210°F (82°C - 99°C) for approximately 30 minutes.

After the hub is up to temperature, quickly remove it from the oven and place the bearing cup into the bore. Carefully tap cup into hub using a criss-cross pattern. Be sure cup is properly seated. If the cup does not fit easily into the hub:

step2.para: Remove cup from hub per cup removal procedure.

step1.para: To verify that the cup is fully seated and aligned, a 0.002" feeler gauge should not fit between the cup and bearing backup.
After hub is at room temperature, proceed with normal seal and hub installation.
